sub_title: Consultant/System engineer for the Space Industry
summary:
+ Software consultant and system engineer with 15 years experience.
+ Specialised in large high profile European Space industry Projects,

Always interested in new opportunities, even if just an advisory/mentor role

Projects that I have been involved in:
- ERA (European Robotic Arm) for ISS (International Space Station)
- Eurobot ( Semi autonomous robot with three anthropomorphic arms designed for EVA activities on ISS and space exploration).
- ECOS (Eurobot control operation station)
- Spaceflight Challenge 1 ( Educational tool for schools released October 2008 )
- Galileo

Specialties: IT               : S/W Architect
Simulators  : Real-time ,Scientific,Engineering & Training (incl. for Cosmonauts)
Scientific    : Simulation, Optics, Astronomy, Spacecraft Eng.,Robotics, Satellite Navigation, System Eng.
Space        : Spacecraft Mission Dynamics & operations, Ground Segment ops., Robotic ops., GPS Ops.,  Working Knowledge of MIL-1553 

Business Management  :	Contract Specification,negotiation, close-out

awards.title: Chair of 8th SpaceTech Symposium 28 June 2019 pace 4.0 : Management & Monitoring of the Environment
awards.description:
8th SpaceTech Symposium 28 June 2019, ESA ESTEC, Noordwijk, the Netherlands
Space 4.0 : Management & Monitoring of the Environment

Space 4.0 services from space allow for remote environmental monitoring of resources such as:
§ Water management and leak detection from space
§ Pollution management, monitoring of pipelines and spill control
§ Land management to sustainably manage rain forest, lumber,crops & soil
§ Detection of liquid resources from space

As stated by the Director General of the European Space Agency, Prof. Jan Wörner's Space 4.0 represents the evolution of the space sector into a new era, characterised by a new playing field. This era is unfolding through interaction between governments, private sector, society and politics. Space 4.0 is analogous to, and is intertwined with, Industry 4.0, which is considered as the unfolding fourth industrial revolution of manufacturing and services.

The Spacetech Symposia presented by TU Graz will explore, analyze and engage the audience with experts in these and related fields.

awards.title: Participation in www.futuremorph.org SPACE
awards.description:
The Future Morph website is aimed to present potential careers to students aged 11-16 years old. I was asked by the Science Council to provide knowledge based on my experience in the space industry.
http://www.futuremorph.org/my-future-finder/space/

awards.title: Chair of "Making Earth Observation Profitable " Symposium
awards.description:
Organized with SpaceTech Alumni Association its 6th annual Post-Graduate Refresher Symposium at ESTEC, Noordwijk, the Netherlands. The topic of the symposium was 'Making Earth Observation Profitable'. The central theme of the symposium addressed whether we finally have entered an era where private investment in Earth Observation is profitable and a sustainable industry is born that addresses traditional markets and new applications such as infotainments.
More information on the symposium series can be found at
http://www.lr.tudelft.nl/en/study/post-graduate-spacetech/spacetech-refresher-symposium/

projects.title: Simulations and EGSE facilities for Space Programes ( SESP 2012 )
projects.description:
Organiser of the international conference ( 25-27 September 2012 )
The main objective of the workshop is to bring together representatives of Space Agencies and Industry to review the state-of-the-art in modelling, simulations and ground systems simulators as well Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE), and to debate the needs and solutions for the future.

profile_positions.title: System engineer

profile_positions.location: ESTEC ( European Space Technology Centre ) Noordwijk
profile_positions.description:
Provided Expert Support to ESA projects :
- Spaceflight Challenge 1 ( ISS educational Game for ESA  )
- ESA Education Robotics DVD for Schools
- Galileo ( GSSF )
- EDR ( European Drawer Rack on-board Columbus )
- ACES
- ATV ( provided DaSS Telemetry relay for Erasmus User Centre )
- Herschel ( IA  Interactive Assistant )
- ESARAD ( 3D graphics support )
 
Responsibilities in this role:
 - MPTE Facility Manager at ERA ( European Robotic Arm ) Project 
- ERA Flight Software System Engineer (ESA)
- ERA Ground Segment System Engineer
- Delivery and Installation in Star City and Korolev of ERA ground segment and equipment.
- Instruction of Russian cosmonaut Instructors on use of ERA ground segment.
- Eurobot (ECOS) technical contact (ESA) 

Also appointed as client-employee Serco liaison officer

volunteer_experiences.description: I am involved in accrediting company training schemes (ACTS) for the IOP. I have been involved in accrediting some of the major Resarch organisations in the UK.

Currently responsible for setting up,  maintaining and updating the ESA presence on Linkedin. This involves selecting and publishing the updates that appear on the ESA Linkedin Company and showcase pages visible to the public.

Co-ordinate  with TU Graz raising awareness of the SpaceTech Masters in Space Systems and Business Engineering (spacetech.tugraz.at)
Maintain worldwide network of Space Professionals who are Spacetech Alumni ( TU-Delft and TU Graz ).
Co-Organise the bi-annual SpaceTech  Alumni Symposium on Space and systems engineering
